body: I have the very same issue. For me, it crashes every time after exactly 143 visited pages.

I had similar error on a page with thousands elements in a drop down menu: #27704
A difference is that in my case the error message was about "handle", whereas an error message in this bug is about "frame"

I also am having this issue, is it not because of a not-awaited promise, or, an promise that resolves after the connection is done? The issue is mentioned [here](https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/21210) as well.

I have a page.on('download') (need to figure out how to make this not trigger after page close) and am getting this error around 63 iterations

issue.title: [BUG] AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute '_object'

repository.name: playwright-python
repository.description: Python version of the Playwright testing and automation library.

issue.body:

issue.title: [BUG]       if (!object) throw new Error(`Object with guid ${arg.guid} was not bound in the connection`);

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
source code:

```
import * as playwright from 'playwright-chromium'
import path from 'path'
import {promises as fs} from 'fs'
import os from 'os'

const context = await playwright.chromium.launchPersistentContext(await fs.mkdtemp(path.join(os.tmpdir(), 'pal')), {channel:'chrome', args:['--disable-blink-features=AutomationControlled', '--start-maximized'], headless:false, recordVideo:{dir:'videos'}, viewport:null})
const page = await context.newPage()
await page.goto('https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x87ytjz')
```

often get the following error: (about 15min to 30min)
```
/home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/playwright-core/lib/client/connection.js:207
      if (!object) throw new Error(`Object with guid ${arg.guid} was not bound in the connection`);
                   ^

Error: Object with guid frame@8a92bb1756f311c737fc3f3651b19832 was not bound in the connection
    at Connection._tChannelImplFromWire (/home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/playwright-core/lib/client/connection.js:207:26)
    at /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/playwright-core/lib/protocol/validatorPrimitives.js:128:20
    at /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/playwright-core/lib/protocol/validatorPrimitives.js:90:12
    at /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/playwright-core/lib/protocol/validatorPrimitives.js:107:21
    at Connection._createRemoteObject (/home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/playwright-core/lib/client/connection.js:218:19)
    at Connection.dispatch (/home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/playwright-core/lib/client/connection.js:177:12)
    at Immediate.<anonymous> (/home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/playwright-core/lib/inProcessFactory.js:48:83)
    at process.processImmediate (node:internal/timers:478:21)
```

I see there are similar errors in the playwright issues, But there are no solution for this situation.

I want to ask whether there is any way to goto 'https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x87ytjz' when the above error happen. I try:
```
import * as playwright from 'playwright-chromium'
import path from 'path'
import {promises as fs} from 'fs'
import os from 'os'

const context = await playwright.chromium.launchPersistentContext(await fs.mkdtemp(path.join(os.tmpdir(), 'pal')), {channel:'chrome', args:['--disable-blink-features=AutomationControlled', '--start-maximized'], headless:false, recordVideo:{dir:'videos'}, viewport:null})
const page = await context.newPage()
while (true)
{
    try
    {
        await page.goto('https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x87ytjz')
        await page.waitForTimeout(1000 * 60 * 30)
    }
   catch {}
}
```
But this way I have to set time explicitly.

I also try page.on('pageerror', async _ => await page.goto('https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x87ytjz')) I get net::err_aborted

Is there any elegant way to reload the page aka goto https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x87ytjz again when the new Error(`Object with guid ${arg.guid} was not bound in the connection`); happen?

issue.title: fix(dispatchers): separate gc bucket for main frame, increased limit

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
- Keep main frames in a separate bucket, so that page methods that redirect to the main frame continue to work.
- Increase default dispatchers limit to `10_000`.
- Increase dispatchers limit for `JSHandle`/`ElementHandle` to `100_000`.

Fixes #28320, #28503.

issue.title: [BUG] Object with guid ${arg.guid} was not bound in the connection

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do not delete this template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->

<!-- ðŸ”Ž Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- ðŸ§ª Test using the latest Playwright release to see if your issue has already been fixed -->
<!-- ðŸ’¡ Provide enough information for us to be able to reproduce your issue locally -->

### System info
- Playwright Version: v1.32.2
- Operating System: Windows 10
- Browser: chromium, firefox, webkit
- Other info: Node v16.14.0

### Source code

- [x] I provided exact source code that allows reproducing the issue locally.

<!-- For simple cases, please provide a self-contained test file along with the config file -->
<!-- For larger cases, you can provide a GitHub repo you created for this issue -->
<!-- If we can not reproduce the problem locally, we won't be able to act on it -->
<!-- You can still file without the exact code and we will try to help, but if we can't repro, it will be closed -->

**package.json**

```json
{
    "name": "testcase",
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "type": "module",
    "dependencies": {
        "playwright": "1.32.2"
    }
}
```

**Test file (self-contained)**

```js
// index.js
import playwright from "playwright";

for (let i = 0; i < 1000; ++i) {
    console.log(i);
    const browser = await playwright.chromium.launch({ slowMo: 250 });
    const context = await browser.newContext();
    const page = await context.newPage();
    page.on("framenavigated", async (frame) => {
        await frame.locator("span").evaluateAll(() => {});
        await frame.addStyleTag({ content: "div {}" });
    });
    await page.goto("https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browser");
    await context.close();
    await browser.close();
}
```

**Steps**
- Unzip [testcase.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/files/11157402/testcase.zip)
- `npm install`
- `DEBUG=pw:api,pw:channel:command,pw:channel:response node index.js`

**Expected**

No error.

**Actual**

```
0
  pw:api => browserType.launch started +0ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 1,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'browser-type@217bc1acf01e8ab60147d89d2aafcd1a',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'launch',
  pw:channel:command   params: { ignoreAllDefaultArgs: false, slowMo: 250 }
  pw:channel:command } +0ms
  pw:channel:response {
  pw:channel:response   id: 1,
  pw:channel:response   result: { browser: { guid: 'browser@457c5f62717d2b86635a9c36c4b2a3a2' } }
  pw:channel:response } +0ms
  pw:api <= browserType.launch succeeded +412ms
  pw:api => browser.newContext started +2ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 2,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'browser@457c5f62717d2b86635a9c36c4b2a3a2',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'newContext',
  pw:channel:command   params: { noDefaultViewport: false }
  pw:channel:command } +413ms
  pw:channel:response {
  pw:channel:response   id: 2,
  pw:channel:response   result: {
  pw:channel:response     context: { guid: 'browser-context@c2725438de82db711cab1d84e6966c97' }
  pw:channel:response   }
  pw:channel:response } +11ms
  pw:api <= browser.newContext succeeded +9ms
  pw:api => browserContext.newPage started +1ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 3,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'browser-context@c2725438de82db711cab1d84e6966c97',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'newPage',
  pw:channel:command   params: undefined
  pw:channel:command } +10ms
  pw:channel:response {
  pw:channel:response   id: 3,
  pw:channel:response   result: { page: { guid: 'page@b84a8ba8e6e23aa2528953cbf97dc5c3' } }
  pw:channel:response } +155ms
  pw:api <= browserContext.newPage succeeded +153ms
  pw:api => page.goto started +1ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 4,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'frame@3ee5e10621a15eaf80cb985dbccb9a28',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'goto',
  pw:channel:command   params: {
  pw:channel:command     url: 'https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browser',
  pw:channel:command     waitUntil: 'load'
  pw:channel:command   }
  pw:channel:command } +154ms
  pw:api navigating to "https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browser", waiting until "load" +2ms
  pw:api   "commit" event fired +45ms
  pw:api   navigated to "https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browser" +1ms
  pw:api => locator.evaluateAll started +3ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 5,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'frame@3ee5e10621a15eaf80cb985dbccb9a28',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'evalOnSelectorAll',
  pw:channel:command   params: {
  pw:channel:command     selector: 'span',
  pw:channel:command     expression: '() => {}',
  pw:channel:command     isFunction: true,
  pw:channel:command     arg: { value: [Object], handles: [] }
  pw:channel:command   }
  pw:channel:command } +51ms
  pw:api   "domcontentloaded" event fired +189ms
  pw:api   "load" event fired +117ms
  pw:channel:response { id: 5, result: { value: { v: 'undefined' } } } +512ms
  pw:api <= locator.evaluateAll succeeded +157ms
  pw:api => frame.addStyleTag started +3ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 6,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'frame@3ee5e10621a15eaf80cb985dbccb9a28',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'addStyleTag',
  pw:channel:command   params: { content: 'div {}' }
  pw:channel:command } +466ms
  pw:channel:response {
  pw:channel:response   id: 4,
  pw:channel:response   result: { response: { guid: 'response@cab1b2a18575669f02a3fbe57676ad7a' } }
  pw:channel:response } +105ms
  pw:api <= page.goto succeeded +100ms
  pw:api => browserContext.close started +3ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 7,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'browser-context@c2725438de82db711cab1d84e6966c97',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'close',
  pw:channel:command   params: undefined
  pw:channel:command } +103ms
  pw:channel:response { id: 7 } +12ms
  pw:api <= browserContext.close succeeded +8ms
  pw:api => browser.close started +1ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 8,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'browser@457c5f62717d2b86635a9c36c4b2a3a2',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'close',
  pw:channel:command   params: undefined
  pw:channel:command } +9ms
  pw:channel:response { id: 8 } +38ms
  pw:api <= browser.close succeeded +38ms
1
  pw:api => browserType.launch started +3ms
  pw:channel:command {
  pw:channel:command   id: 9,
  pw:channel:command   guid: 'browser-type@217bc1acf01e8ab60147d89d2aafcd1a',
  pw:channel:command   method: 'launch',
  pw:channel:command   params: { ignoreAllDefaultArgs: false, slowMo: 250 }
  pw:channel:command } +42ms
  pw:channel:response {
  pw:channel:response   id: 6,
  pw:channel:response   result: { element: { guid: 'handle@7833e65f500bd1d978e1450a5459c7bb' } }
  pw:channel:response } +238ms
C:\Users\regseb\dev\testcase\node_modules\playwright-core\lib\client\connection.js:211
      if (!object) throw new Error(`Object with guid ${arg.guid} was not bound in the connection`);
                   ^

Error: Object with guid handle@7833e65f500bd1d978e1450a5459c7bb was not bound in the connection
    at Connection._tChannelImplFromWire (C:\Users\regseb\dev\testcase\node_modules\playwright-core\lib\client\connection.js:211:26)
    at C:\Users\regseb\dev\testcase\node_modules\playwright-core\lib\protocol\validatorPrimitives.js:129:20
    at C:\Users\regseb\dev\testcase\node_modules\playwright-core\lib\protocol\validatorPrimitives.js:108:21
    at Connection.dispatch (C:\Users\regseb\dev\testcase\node_modules\playwright-core\lib\client\connection.js:170:26)
    at Immediate.<anonymous> (C:\Users\regseb\dev\testcase\node_modules\playwright-core\lib\inProcessFactory.js:46:83)
    at processImmediate (node:internal/timers:466:21)
```

### Additional info

- I add style with `frame.addStyleTag()`.
  - Playwright sends a command to the browser to add style (using a protocol close to [JSON-RPC](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification)).
    ```javascript
    {
      id: 6,
      guid: 'frame@3ee5e10621a15eaf80cb985dbccb9a28',
      method: 'addStyleTag',
      params: { content: 'div {}' }
    }
    ``` 
- I close the browser.
  - Playwright _removes_ the callbacks from the commands.
- Playwright receives the response from the command.
  ```JavaScript
  {
    id: 6,
    result: { element: { guid: 'handle@7833e65f500bd1d978e1450a5459c7bb' } }
  }
  ```
  - Playwright doesn't find the callback associated with the command and throws an exception.
    https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/blob/ecd0f927f4f0efb396aec1a839b4252b229f8ae0/packages/playwright-core/src/client/connection.ts#L191-L193

### Related issues

- https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/20023
- https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/21210#issuecomment-1477840641
- https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/21210#issuecomment-1506956035
- https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/27704
- https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/28214
- https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/28320
- https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/28504
